content.description: Climb sustained 5.8ish climbing to the crux between the last bolt and the anchors.
content.location: This climb is the second to the last bolted climb on the High Gravity Wall.  It is right in front of the spruce tree at the corner.  The first bolt does not have a hanger on it for whatever reason....

content.description:
Fear is Never Boring is a great route with fun moves and some wild exposure!

The route is mostly sustained 5.9 with a couple of 5.10 cruxes. There are three rappel stations, which allows the use of one 60m rope. The first pitch is 180 feet and can be broken up into two pitches, but it is best to climb past the first set of anchors (which is a little off route anyway). The second pitch is 80 feet and gains anchors at the top of the wall.

Rappel the route, three rappels.
content.protection: 16 draws for the 180' first pitch. If you don't have 16 draws, the route can be broken up into 3 pitches (not recommended). Use a 60m rope.
content.location: This is an obvious route up the middle of the wall. The climb finishes to the right of a large right-facing corner at the top of the wall.

content.description: A fun and well bolted climb on mostly easy climb with some 5.10 moves for spice.The start has a bouldering move to a  cave.
content.protection: 10 bolts and anchor. A 60 meter rope.
content.location: The spire is on the far east side of High Gravity Wall, just right of The Outward Bound Crag.

climbs.name: City Boy
climbs.fa: S. Johnson & A. Edmonds - P1, S. Johnson & B. Bernholtz - P2

content.description: While the first pitch isn't all that special, the second pitch more than makes up for it and is a must do.  Thin, sustained technical climbing sums it up with a possible crux near the start of the second pitch, although the true crux (if there is one) may vary from climber to climber due to the continuous nature of the route.
content.protection: Pitch one has 5 bolts to a 2 bolt anchor.  Pitch two has 9 bolts to a 2 bolt anchor.
content.location: This is the farthest route to the left on the High Gravity Wall.
